pageContext.claim: “In the past 12 months alone, the average worker has taken home $1,000 extra in rising wages and over $3,000 with tax cuts and all of the other things that we've done.”
pageContext.analysis: The $1,000 in rising wages is barely enough to cover inflation. The rest of Trump's claim -- $3,000 from "tax cuts" and other things we've done -- is based on dubious math.
